summary: This document is an email chain regarding the delivery of surveillance equipment (PTZ cameras) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It includes tracking numbers for shipments delivered in November 2018 and identifies the sender as a Program Manager for SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, and the recipient as a Communication Technician at the MCC.

persons.name: Program Manager FBOP Contracts SigNet Technologies I Convergint Federal Solutions
persons.context: Sender of the email confirming delivery of surveillance equipment to MCC New York, representing SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions.

persons.name: Communication Technician US Department of Justice MCC-New York
persons.context: Recipient of the email, following up on the delivery of outside PTZ cameras for the MCC New York facility.

keyFacts: Surveillance equipment (PTZ cameras) was delivered to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in November 2018.
The equipment was supplied by SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions under a Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) contract.
The email correspondence occurred in October 2019, following up on the 2018 delivery.
Tracking numbers for multiple shipments are listed, indicating a formal procurement and delivery process.
The document highlights the operational logistics of a federal detention facility, specifically regarding security infrastructure.
